summary: Kenneth D. Klein was an employee of the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents available primarily relate to his payroll records, salary adjustments, and termination details within the HSCA. The records indicate his employment occurred around 1977. The documents do not provide specific details about his role within the HSCA or his direct involvement in the JFK assassination investigation, but rather focus on the administrative aspects of his employment.
significance: Kenneth D. Klein's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, a committee formed to investigate the assassination of JFK. While the available documents do not detail his specific contributions to the investigation, his payroll records are part of the broader set of HSCA staff records reviewed by the Assassination Records Review Board.
